010package imagingbook.lib.ij;
011
012import java.nio.file.Path;
013import java.util.Arrays;
014import java.util.Comparator;
015import java.util.LinkedList;
016import java.util.List;
017import java.util.Objects;
018
019import ij.ImagePlus;
020import ij.WindowManager;
021import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
022import ij.io.OpenDialog;
023import ij.io.Opener;
024import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
025import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
026import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
027import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
028import ij.process.ShortProcessor;
029
030
031/**
032 * TODO: Clarify assumed arrangement of 2D arrays!
033 * @author WB
034 *
035 */
036public abstract class IjUtils {
037        
038        /**
039         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of ImagePlus objects that are
040         * sorted by their titles if the 'sortByTitle' flag is set.
041         * 
042         * @param sortByTitle flag, result is sorted if true.
043         * @return an array of currently open images.
044         */
045        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle) {
046                return getOpenImages(sortByTitle, null);
047        }
048        
049
050        /**
051         * Returns an array of strings containing the short titles
052         * of the images supplied.
053         * 
054         * @param images array of images.
055         * @return array of names.
056         */
057        public static String[] getImageShortTitles(ImagePlus[] images) {
058                String[] imageNames = new String[images.length];
059                for (int i = 0; i < images.length; i++) {
060                        imageNames[i] = images[i].getShortTitle();
061                }
062                return imageNames;
063        }
064        
065        /**
066         * Opens a dialog to let the user select one of the currently open images.
067         * @param title string to show in the dialog
068         * @return An ImagePlus object, use the getProcessor method to obtain the associated ImageProcessor
069         */
070        public static ImagePlus selectOpenImage(String title) {
071                ImagePlus[] openImages = getOpenImages(true, null);
072                String[] imageNames = getImageShortTitles(openImages);
073                if (title == null) {
074                        title = "image:";
075                }
076                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog("Select image");
077                gd.addChoice(title, imageNames, imageNames[0]);
078                gd.showDialog(); 
079                if (gd.wasCanceled()) 
080                        return null;
081                else {
082                        return openImages[gd.getNextChoiceIndex()];
083                }
084        }
085        
086        
087        /**
088         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects that are
089         * sorted by their titles if the sortByTitle flag is set.
090         * The image "exclude" (typically the current image) is not included 
091         * in the returned array (pass null to exclude no image).
092         * 
093         * @param sortByTitle set {@code true} to return images sorted by title
094         * @param exclude reference to an image to be excluded (may be {@code null})
095         * @return a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects
096         */
097        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle, ImagePlus exclude) {
098                List<ImagePlus> imgList = new LinkedList<ImagePlus>();
099                int[] wList = WindowManager.getIDList();
100        if (wList != null) {
101                for (int i : wList) {
102                    ImagePlus imp = WindowManager.getImage(i);
103                    if (imp != null && imp != exclude) {
104                        imgList.add(imp);
105                    }
106                }
107        }
108        ImagePlus[] impArr = imgList.toArray(new ImagePlus[0]);
109        if (sortByTitle) {
110                Comparator<ImagePlus> cmp = new Comparator<ImagePlus>() {
111                        public int compare(ImagePlus impA, ImagePlus impB) {
112                                return impA.getTitle().compareTo(impB.getTitle());
113                        }
114                };
115                Arrays.sort(impArr, cmp);
116        }
117                return impArr;
118        }
119        
120
121        /**
122         *  Queries the user for an arbitrary file to be opened.
123         *  
124         * @param title string to be shown in the interaction window.
125         * @return path of the selected resource.
126         */
127        public static String askForOpenPath(String title) {
128                OpenDialog od = new OpenDialog(title, "");
129                String dir = od.getDirectory();
130                String name = od.getFileName();
131                if (name == null)
132                        return null;
133                return encodeURL(dir + name);
134        }
135        
136        private static String encodeURL(String url) {
137                //url = url.replaceAll(" ","%20");      // this doesn't work with spaces
138                url = url.replace('\\','/');
139                return url;
140        }
141        
142        //----------------------------------------------------------------------
143        
144
145        /**
146         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D array),
147         * where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
148         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate.
149         * Use {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
150         * 
151         * @param title image title
152         * @param M 2D array
153         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} image
154         */
155        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, float[][] M) {
156                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
157                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
158                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
159                                fp.setf(u, v, M[v][u]);
160                        }
161                }
162                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
163        }
164        
165
166        /**
167         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D array),
168         * where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
169         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate.
170         * Use {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
171         * 
172         * @param title the image title
173         * @param M a 2D array holding the image data
174         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} instance
175         */
176        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, double[][] M) {
177                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
178                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
179                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
180                                fp.setf(u, v, (float) M[v][u]);
181                        }
182                }
183                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
184        }
185        
186        /**
187         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used
188         * in RGB-to-grayscale conversion for the specified image {@code ip}.
189         * Note that this method can be applied to any {@link ImageProcessor}
190         * instance but has no effect unless {@code ip} is of type
191         * {@link ColorProcessor}. Applies standard (ITU-709) weights.
192         * 
193         * @param ip The affected image
194         */
195        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip) {
196                setRgbConversionWeights(ip, 0.299, 0.587, 0.114);
197        }
198        
199        /**
200         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used
201         * in RGB-to-grayscale conversion for the specified image {@code ip}.
202         * Note that this method can be applied to any {@link ImageProcessor}
203         * instance but has no effect unless {@code ip} is of type
204         * {@link ColorProcessor}.
205         * 
206         * @param ip The affected image
207         * @param wr Red weight
208         * @param wg Green weight
209         * @param wb Blue weight
210         */
211        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip, double wr, double wg, double wb) {
212                if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
213                        ((ColorProcessor) ip).setRGBWeights(wr, wg, wb);
214                }
215        }
216        
217        
218        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
219        
220        /** 
221         * Returns a copy of the pixel data as a 2D double
222         * array with dimensions [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
223         * @param fp the image
224         * @return the resulting array
225         */
226        public static double[][] toDoubleArray(FloatProcessor fp) {
227                final int width = fp.getWidth();
228                final int height = fp.getHeight();
229                float[] fPixels = (float[]) fp.getPixels();
230                double[][] dPixels = new double[width][height];
231                int i = 0;
232                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
233                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
234                                dPixels[u][v] = fPixels[i];
235                                i++;
236                        }
237                }
238                return dPixels;
239        }
240        
241        /**
242         * Creates a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance of size width x height
243         * from the given 2D array with dimensions [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
244         * 
245         * @param dPixels a 2D {@code double} array
246         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
247         */
248        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(double[][] dPixels) {
249                final int width = dPixels.length;
250                final int height = dPixels[0].length;
251                float[] fPixels = new float[width * height];
252                int i = 0;
253                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
254                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
255                                fPixels[i] = (float) dPixels[u][v];
256                                i++;
257                        }
258                }
259                return new FloatProcessor(width, height, fPixels);
260        }
261        
262        // Open image from path (used with resources)
263        
264        /**
265         * Opens the image from the specified path and returns it
266         * as a {@link ImagePlus} instance.
267         * 
268         * @param name The simple name of the image file (including extension)
269         * @return A new {@link ImagePlus} instance or {@code null} if not found
270         */
271        public static ImagePlus openImage(Path name) {
272                Objects.requireNonNull(name);
273                return new Opener().openImage(name.toString());
274        }
275        
276        
277        // Methods for checking/comparing images (primarily used for testing)  ---------------------
278        
279        /**
280         * Checks if two images are of the same type.
281         * 
282         * @param ip1 the first image
283         * @param ip2 the second image
284         * @return true if both images have the same type
285         */
286        public static boolean sameType(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
287                return ip1.getClass().equals(ip2.getClass());
288        }
289        
290        /**
291         * Checks if two images have the same size.
292         * 
293         * @param ip1 the first image
294         * @param ip2 the second image
295         * @return true if both images have the same size
296         */
297        public static boolean sameSize(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
298                return ip1.getWidth() == ip2.getWidth() && ip1.getHeight() == ip2.getHeight();
299        }
300        
301        /**
302         * Checks if the given image is possibly a binary image. This requires that
303         * the image contains at most two different pixel values, one of which
304         * must be zero. All pixels are checked.
305         * This should work for all image types.
306         * More efficient implementations are certainly possible.
307         * 
308         * @param ip the image ({@link ImageProcessor}) to be checked
309         * @return true if the image is binary
310         */
311        public static boolean isBinary(ImageProcessor ip) {
312                final int width = ip.getWidth();
313                final int height = ip.getHeight();
314                int fgVal = 0;
315                boolean binary = true;
316                
317                outer:
318                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
319                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
320                                int val = 0x007FFFFF & ip.get(u, v); // = mantissa in case of float
321                                if (val != 0) {
322                                        if (fgVal == 0) {       // first non-zero value
323                                                fgVal = val;
324                                        }
325                                        else if (val != fgVal) {        // found another non-zero value
326                                                binary = false;
327                                                break outer;
328                                        }
329                                }
330                        }
331                }
332                
333                return binary;
334        }
335        
336        public static final double DefaultMatchTolerance = 1E-6;
337        
338        /**
339         * Checks if two images have the same type, size and content (using 
340         * {@link #DefaultMatchTolerance}).
341         * 
342         * @param ip1 the first image
343         * @param ip2 the second image
344         * @return true if both images have the same type and content
345         */
346        public static boolean match(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
347                return match(ip1, ip2, DefaultMatchTolerance);
348        }
349        
350        /**
351         * Checks if two images have the same type, size and content (using 
352         * the specified tolerance). 
353         * 
354         * @param ip1 the first image
355         * @param ip2 the second image
356         * @param tolerance the matching tolerance
357         * @return true if both images have the same type, size and content
358         */
359        public static boolean match(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2, double tolerance) {
360                if (!sameType(ip1, ip2)) {
361                        return false;
362                }
363                if (!sameSize(ip1, ip2)) {
364                        return false;
365                }
366                
367                if (ip1 instanceof ByteProcessor) {
368                        byte[] p1 = (byte[]) ip1.getPixels();
369                        byte[] p2 = (byte[]) ip2.getPixels();
370                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
371                }
372                else if (ip1 instanceof ShortProcessor) {
373                        short[] p1 = (short[]) ip1.getPixels();
374                        short[] p2 = (short[]) ip2.getPixels();
375                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
376                }
377                else if (ip1 instanceof ColorProcessor) {
378                        int[] p1 = (int[]) ip1.getPixels();
379                        int[] p2 = (int[]) ip2.getPixels();
380                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
381                }
382                
383                else if (ip1 instanceof FloatProcessor) {
384                        float[] p1 = (float[]) ip1.getPixels();
385                        float[] p2 = (float[]) ip2.getPixels();
386                        boolean same = true;
387                        final float toleranceF = (float) tolerance;
388                        for (int i = 0; i < p1.length; i++) {
389                                if (Math.abs(p1[i] - p2[i]) > toleranceF) {
390                                        same = false;
391                                        break;
392                                }
393                        }
394                        return same;
395                }
396
397                throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip1.getClass().getSimpleName());
398        }
399
400}
